text: Hey! I am looking for someone who has developed content for website in B2B niche or marketing (HR, leadership development) for a startup company. I am myself a freelance writer and want to collaborate/distribute my project who is willing to work on the same. However, I would prefer an Indian writer as the pay would be in INR. If anybody is interested pls feel free to DM me for more details. :)

text: I have that experience but am not Indian. If you don’t find someone, feel free to DM me.

text: Hey everyone! I am new here so not sure this is the right place to post this (let me know if not). I have been a freelancer for 5 years and I am looking at different possibilities moving forward to sort out my taxes (I am resident in Italy, and from next year I'd have to pay almost 40% of taxes etc. on my earnings). I move around a lot and actually haven't lived in Italy for the past 4 years, what's the solution you guys went for? E-residency in Estonia? Registering your business in Dubai? I hear lots of different opinions and I'd like to know what's your experience :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Hey everyone! I am new here so not sure this is the right place to post this (let me know if not). I have been a freelancer for 5 years and I am looking at different possibilities moving forward to sort out my taxes (I am resident in Italy, and from next year I'd have to pay almost 40% of taxes etc. on my earnings). I move around a lot and actually haven't lived in Italy for the past 4 years, what's the solution you guys went for? E-residency in Estonia? Registering your business in Dubai? I hear lots of different opinions and I'd like to know what's your experience

text:
From my experience:
• Get clients from overseas, some countries have a lower tax rate or exempt you from some when you export services (in Mexico I save 16% VAT tax per month just because of this).

• Get paid in cryptocurrency and hold it in a stablecoin that has the same value as the USD or EUR all the time. Your crypto should not visible to any government on certain exchanges.

Only withdraw what you are going to spend and declare as little money left as possible month by month.

You'd be technically "earning less", thus your tax burden may decrease.

Also, find ways to spend your crypto, <https://bitrefill.com/> may be useful to find giftcards on many stores.

I have been doing this for a year and so far so good. From 30% of taxes, I should be paying, I'm now paying less than 10% each month.

From others:
• Open a bank account in a tax haven like Georgia and funnel all your income there, don't declare it (a friend of mine has been doing this + the crypto thing for years while traveling the world).

Hope it helps!

text:
Calling freelance writers, please DM me if you're interested in the following opportunity:

The partner team at a leading SaaS company is preparing to launch two new certifications to partners focusing on pre-sales and implementation.
We are looking for someone to take the given information and create two 30-minute presentations that partners can watch and receive certification upon completion.
Deliverables: Slide deck + script for pre-sales presentation Slide deck + script for implementation presentation
Each presentation should be about 30 minutes when read aloud. The information for the presentation will be provided in many different formats (slide deck, documents, etc.).
You will determine the flow of the presentation, what information should be on each slide, and the script that will accompany the visuals.
You will use our branded slide deck and there will be between 30-50 slides. The creative team will review the deck for formatting, etc. (the emphasis is on the content within the slides and script, not on visuals). When complete, the team will record these presentations and provide the videos to partners so they can earn these certifications.
